intro: Clermontia waimeae, commonly known as the Waimea Clermontia, is an endangered flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Oahu. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers and broad, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas of mesic forests, often near streams or in rocky crevices. It is distinguished by its unique floral structure and is considered a keystone species in its native habitat. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
